review: Don't know why I waited so long!  Our local cable company now requires you to have a box to receive their signal, didn't want to buy a box for every TV in the house, so this Fire TV Stick is the perfect solution.  I've been watching Netflix more than regular programming anyway and now we can watch shows on any TV in the house.  I love the fact that you program it ONCE for your wireless network, Netflix & other passwords.  Then transport it to wherever you want to watch - just plug it in to that set.

author: Bhagwan Bill

review: The FireTV is a nice little streaming device, with a lot of potential if Amazon keeps releasing good firmware updates. The specs are fantastic on paper--1GB of RAM and a nice dual core CPU. In terms of price-to-performance ratio, it's hard to beat. Add in the great feature set--all the various streaming options that you'd expect (Amazon Plus, Hulu, Netflix, HBO, etc), and it's worth a purchase.The downsides: it has some major Wifi connectivity issues, that are well-documented. Mine cuts out regularly, despite being only 2-3 feet from the router. The UI can also be somewhat sluggish, which is sort of shocking considering how powerful this little device is. Another issue is the remote, which regularly registers a single click as two or more. So you'll be clicking through the menu and all of a sudden it jumps 2-3 clicks ahead. Very annoying.Hopefully, Amazon can resolve the Wifi, UI sluggishness, and remote issues through a firmware update. Until then, this device has great potential, but it's flaws show it's only half-baked.
